title: Sometimes channel is not fetched if opened after joining community (E2E blocker)

milestone.title: 1.27.0 - Alpha
milestone.description:
### This release will be used for wide internal dogfooding 

Mobile dev team priorities In priority order:

**1. Finish anything that wasn't completed in the previous 1.26 cycle**

**2. Select which accounts to share with each Community's control node**
- Designs should be ready for review and dev feedback by 18th September

**3. Settings home screen**
- the settings home screen only

**4. Fix bugs, both functional and UX fit-and-finish defects.**  

- specifically focus on bugs related to the Communities functionality, when a community is utilizing all the community admin functionality available in Status Desktop

- any remaining UX quality defects

- ensure all community token gating related functionality is working

body:
According to @Parveshdhull [comment](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/17704#issuecomment-1778973906) this issue might require fix on status-go side.

This issues is often caught by our e2e causing the whole group of tests to fail. So it can be considered as test blocker. 

Sometimes this bug is also reproducible manually.

**Steps:** 

1. User A creates community which does not require admin manual approval. Use PR build to create community from mobile. 
2. User A sends community invite to User B
3. User B sends Request to join the community
4. Wait until community status is changed to Joined for User B
5. User B opens community channel
6. See if channel is fetched


**Actual result:** sometimes channel is not fetched

[logs (11).zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/13068070/logs.11.zip)

https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/97245802/162146e5-2e12-4589-ae82-7f0e1dc9a318

**Expected result:** channel is fetched

### Additional Information

- Status version: nightly 
- Operating System: Android, iOS

Hi @pavloburykh , I attempted to reproduce the issue within the `develop` branch but wasn't able to encounter it when testing on an iOS simulator. Do you have any suggestions on how I might increase the likelihood of observing this issue?

> Hi @pavloburykh , I attempted to reproduce the issue within the `develop` branch but wasn't able to encounter it when testing on an iOS simulator. Do you have any suggestions on how I might increase the likelihood of observing this issue?

@mohsen-ghafouri Unfortunately, the issue occurs infrequently. I was able to reproduce it once today, but since then, I haven't been able to replicate it.

 I've attached the logs, hopefully, they can provide some details.
[Status-debug-logs.zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/13295430/Status-debug-logs.zip)

> Hi @pavloburykh , I attempted to reproduce the issue within the `develop` branch but wasn't able to encounter it when testing on an iOS simulator. Do you have any suggestions on how I might increase the likelihood of observing this issue?

Hey @mohsen-ghafouri! Thank you for looking at the issue. It is really hard to reproduce. 

BTW, are you creating community from mobile? As for now we have faced this issue in the flow when we are creating community from mobile PR builds (not from Desktop). Try to follow the steps below (though they do not guarantee reproduction) 

**Steps:** 

1. Create new mobile users A and B. 
2. Create 'open community' by User B
3. User B shares community to User A 
4. Stay online by User B admin node
5. User A opens shared community card from 1-1 chat
6. User A sends community join request
7. Wait until community status is changed to Joined for User A. 
8. User A opens community channel 
9. See if channel is fetched. 

**Actual result:** sometimes channel is not fetched after joining the community. But indeed, this issue is kind a random. It is hard to reproduce.

Yes i did it from mobile and exactly these steps but couldn't reproduce it , will try some more and if i could reproduce it will assign the issue to my self 
@pavloburykh
@ilmotta yes but the issue is i couldn't reproduce the issue with mobile community either. i created many communities with mobile and didn't see this kind of issue.

@ilmotta @mohsen-ghafouri  

**UPDATE:**

I have just managed to reproduce this bug with Desktop community. So issue is not related only to test communities created on mobile. 

As you can see from video below channel is not fetched after joining the community. After re-login it works as expected. 

[logs (15).zip](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/files/13392072/logs.15.zip)

https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/97245802/7bdee2f8-aa4d-4bbd-bf3e-b53f93c4344c
I'll look into this, since it blocks my PR : https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/17773

I am able to reproduce this issue very easily on android emulator when building for x86_64 crash fix branch.
Seems like a TCP socket issue from the surface, this could be the reason why it happens less on develop and more on my branch.
The goal however is to find a fix for develop.
Debugging further, will post my investigations here.

Another key thing I noticed is that, although on opening a the community channel we see a loading indicator. as soon as I send a message from Device A ( creator of community ) on general channel, Device B ( where we see loading channel ) immediately loads up the channel.

As mentioned by @pavloburykh the empty channel does load up when you sign out and sign back in. So probably something happens when we logout and log back in that causes the channel to load up. A similar thing happens when creator of open community sends a message on that channel. The fix maybe on both status-mobile and status-go side.

Messages are fetched by this function `messages-by-chat-id-rpc`  here : https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/develop/src/status_im/data_store/messages.cljs#L83-L93 

This code calls `wakuext_chatMessages` at status-go which returns `nil` as a call back when user navigates to general channel. Could be because there are no messages.

However from what I see when this re-frame event is dispatched `:chat.ui/load-more-messages-for-current-chat` 
The UI updates and resolves the loading screen to an empty chat view.. This is what should have happened when the user visits the channel the first time as well.

This only happens when we log out and log back in and then open the community channel.

This event is dispatched inside `list-on-end-reached` here : https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/blob/develop/src/status_im2/contexts/chat/messages/list/view.cljs#L71-L84

Which passes a callback to update a few shared values in re-animated, I wonder if modifying this code will solve this issue.
We see the loading skeleton view because this sub returns false/nil `(rf/sub [:chats/all-loaded? chat-id])`

The problem is after joining the community, app-db (`:chats/..`) don't have chat data for the general channel chat-id, and that's why UI is not shown and just a loading skeleton shown.

Not sure why this chat is never returned by status-go when joining the community in case of PR builds, but when I was debugging this issue status-go always returned the chat, but sometimes with significant delay.

> So probably something happens when we logout and log back in that causes the channel to load up.
> A similar thing happens when creator of open community sends a message on that channel.

So, somehow community joining process is failing or delaying sending signal related to chat data, but we still are able to get that chat in other ways.

I added some extensive logging here : https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/pull/17773/commits/d25a5a92e2063b68e05437195db49278bf84a324

These are the relevant logs

> or delaying sending signal related to chat data So something happens when admin sends a message on general channel that causes this device to get the signal. A similar thing also happens when Device B logs out and logs back in. They mean that the bug is indeed in status-go implementation of when an open community was joined and further investigation must go in that direction.

The entry point in status-go which gets invoked by status-mobile for creating "Open community" is here : 
https://github.com/status-im/status-go/blob/develop/protocol/messenger_community_for_mobile_testing.go#L93-L103

I hope to write a failing test in status-go to try and replicate this behaviour.

Special Thanks to @cammellos for helping me identify that in the log message below `chatID` key should not have been empty, this helped me solve this issue.
 
